newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - October 16.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - October 16.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Wednesday. Reuter has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - Prosecutors investigate land-related graft case in central city of Taichung, searching provincial councillor's company for evidence.
Parliament's scheduled review of fourth nuclear power plant does not take place, delayed by opposition protests.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - Prosecutors search for evidence in land-related corruption scandal.
Parliament's review of fourth nuclear power plant will have final vote on Friday.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Domestic oil prices may rise over five percent by end of October.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Postponing completion of fourth nuclear power plant to 2006 from 2005 will cost additional T$100 billion (US$3.6 billion).
